p: The number of publications between 1990 and 2014 on ‘climate change’ and ‘climate change and health’ are presented in Fig. 1a and b. Publications on health in Science Direct remained in the three-digit range until 2003 (barring a peak in 1996). We observed an exponential trend since 2003, albeit with a flatter slope for health publications ( Fig. 1a). The search was also carried out in PubMed, where the same increasing trend was observed, with the number of publications on climate change and health crossing the three-digit mark in 2004, plateauing briefly in 2010, and continuing to increase through 2014 ( Fig. 1b).
